result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Yaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bomb Scares, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.015.
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Transfer of probation authorized to another state upon mutual consent to department.

miscConds.notes: Def not to contact law enforcement through electronic methods, i.e. texts, social media or email. Def not to use computer with internet systems unless work related or approved by agent.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: W/ Huber. NO credit to apply to count 1 conditional jail sentence.

supervisions.notes: Sentence deemed served by 68 days sentence credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Yaker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of right to seek postconviction relief.

Reporter:  Denise Severson - Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael A Yaker in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1 & 2.  Court accepted def's plea, found and adjudged defn guilty.  Atty Short needs to provide some things to the state before sentencing.  Ct. will change next status conference on 7-5-2016 to sentencing hearing. State agrees to cap at 3 years probation (parties free to argue conditions of probation) with 1 year conditional jail time. State also agrees not to charge bail jumping from previous non appearance on this case. Chapter 950 compliance. Bail revoked.

AMENDED CASH BOND - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $100,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not be within 1000 ft of the City-County Building or the Dane County Courthouse unless there for official business.
- Defendant shall not be within 1000 feet of Ismael O. unless for official court business.
- Defendant shall not use any social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)
Trial judge -  Br 5
Status conference on June 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Michael J. Short.  Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael A Yaker in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for State of Wisconsin. Ct to set bail for defendant who is being held on body only bench warrant. Atty Gabrysiak requests that bail be set at $100,000 cash bail. Atty Short does not object to the amount and/or bail monitoring and expresses interest to resolve case.  Atty Short advises the court that he is in negotiations for a possible plea with Atty Gabrysiak. Ct grants state's motion and orders cash bail of $15,000 forfeited.  Ct finds that cash bail is necessary & sets cash bail in the amount of $100,000.  Ct also orders that if defendant does post cash bail then defendant will be required to report to DCBM.   Also if defendant fails to comply with DCBM then defendant will be held in custody or a body only bench warrant will be issued.  Defendant is also ordered to have no contact with Detective Greg Esser with Madison Police Department.
to forfeit bond - filed by AAG Jeffrey M. Gabrysiak

Attorney Antonette Hue Laitsch in court on behalf of defendant.  Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant failed to appear for a Status Conference on 3-18-16. Ct authorized bench warrant.
AAG Gabrysiak request to reschedule2-15-16 jury selection and 2-16-16 Jury trial, Request granted court will send new notice (1-26-2016)
Atty Musser moves to withdraw as counsel.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  Court has collequey with defendant about obtaining an attorney.
Defendant stands mute.  Court enters plea of not guilty. Motions due in 20 days.

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $15,000 per case with BMP removed as a condition of bond. All other bail conditions remain set.  Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
Court adjourned arraignment and final pretrial hearing; Atty Musser phoned the Court and advised he was ill and could not appear; Court will reschedule all court hearings

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:40
Defendant in court with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

Defendant in court with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Kristin K. Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Monitoring Program-Out of State Tracel Request

- Cash bail is set at $3000.00 per case. This case bail shall revert to a signature bond on September 14, 2015 at 10:00 AM in the amount of $500 per case. Defendant must immediately report to DCBM.  If the defendant posts the $3000.00 cash bail he must report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his release from the jail. If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $15,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not be within 1000 ft of the City-County Building or the Dane County Courthouse unless there for official business.
- Defendant shall not be within 1000 feet of Ismael O. unless for official court business.
- Defendant shall not use any social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Daniel Craig Musser.  Jeffrey Mark Gabrysiak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $3,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $15,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ismael O.
- Defendant shall not be at the City County Building or the Dane County Courthouse unless there for a scheduled court hearing.
- Defendant shall not use the internet unless supervised by a responsible adult.
